data.event: The settlement became part of Greene County, Missouri when that county was organized in 1833.

event.title: proclaimed the settlement as a city, named it Bolivar, and designated it as the county seat on 10 November 1835

data.event: After the northern part of Greene County was ceded to form Polk County, Missouri, the Polk County Court proclaimed the settlement as a city, named it Bolivar, and designated it as the county seat on 10 November 1835.

event.title: was re-organized as a fourth-class city 15 February 1881

data.event: Bolivar was re-organized as a fourth-class city 15 February 1881.
Bolivar experienced growth in 1884 when the St. Louisâ€“San Francisco Railway was extended to that point.
